intro: Scoparia nudicaulis subsp. praedensa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scurvygrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, linear leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater habitats. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
